events.title: Globe Theatre Destroyed by Fire
events.description: The Globe Theatre in London, associated with William Shakespeare, was destroyed by a fire during a performance of Henry VIII.
events.significance: Marked a significant moment in theatrical history, impacting Shakespeare's company and the history of English drama.

events.title: Federal-Aid Highway Act Signed
events.description: U.S. President Dwight D. Eisenhower signed the Federal-Aid Highway Act of 1956, initiating the creation of the Interstate Highway System.
events.significance: Led to the development of the extensive interstate road network, transforming American transportation and economy.

events.title: Concorde Makes Final Commercial Flight
events.description: The Concorde supersonic passenger jet made its last commercial flight, marking the end of the era of commercial supersonic travel.
events.significance: Closed a chapter in aviation history with the retirement of the iconic Concorde after 27 years of service.

events.title: King James Bible Published
events.description: The King James Version of the Bible was first published in England, becoming one of the most influential English translations.
events.significance: Had a profound effect on English literature, religion, and language for centuries.
